summary:
A night of revelations
Remus Lupin x Reader
title:
A night of revelations
Remus Lupin x Reader
body:
Summary: Reader becomes suspicious of Remus’ odd behaviors and becomes determined to get to the bottom of it.

A//N: a bit of angst and mentions of blood and near death experiences

            Finding out about his lycanthropy was surprising to say the least. Although, Y/N felt idiotic for not realizing it sooner.

 It was a gradual process of deduction which began when Remus would refuse studying and the such every three to four weeks that coincided which a full moon, or that Potter, Black, and Pettigrew were on his heel at every waking moment and fulfilling his every desire and repelling any unwanted company. Remus would develop erie sense of isolation  and he’d become easily irritated or upset. This was a bit of a shock considering Remus’ usual calm and shy demeanor. Though, Y/N was never too suspicious. In fact, Y/N had rarely considered it to be too concerning. It was Remus after all. The most reliable person on the planet Y/N would know.

Of course, Y/N felt a pang of empathy for Remus, but after knowing each other for such a long time this cycle became far too familiar. Although, she could not deny how it pained to watch a close friend be so miserable.

It wasn’t until Amelia had brought it up that Y/N really found it odd.

“Do you ever find it curious that Remus always leaves around the same time each month?” She had asked after transfiguration.

“Pardon?” Y/N asked, looking away from Remus grimly trailing behind Potter, Black, and Pettigrew as they joked around.

“You’ve never noticed that he misses class due to a family illness, a distant relative coming over, or an excuse like that? I mean you off all people should notice Remus’ absence. It’s not like you never sh-”

“All right! I get it.” Y/N exclaimed blushing at Amelia’s antics.

“But really, you don’t find it curious”

“Well, yes, but…?” Y/N had never really put much thought in to it. “It is a bit curious” Y/N concluded eyeing Remus whose shoulders seemed to sink into the ground. It was all too monotonous.



Y/N approached Remus on their way to the great hall, deciding to put an end to the mysterious cycle.

“Hey, Rem!” She called out after Remus, giddily running up to him, and greeted him with a warm grin as an attempted to lift his spirits.

“Hello.” He returned the greeting with an indifferent inflection in his voice. Y/N felt a pang of hurt of his lack of excitement, but her mission did not waver and proceeded.

“So, everything ok?” Y/N asked expectingly

“Yes, why wouldn’t it be?” He seemed very defensive, but Y/N continued.

“Well, you seem a bit off. I don’t know, I just see you acting very-“ Y/N didn’t know how to word it. Miserable. Standoffish. Fearful. “I just want to know if my friend is all right.”

“I’m fine.” He stated, obviously irritated.

“Well, you know you can tell me anything. I’ll help anyway I can. I just—You get so angry-” Y/N regretted those words immediately.

“And what! You don’t like me like this! Is this an inconvenience  for you! Does this disturb you!” Remus roared out, stopping everyone in their tracts. She stood as silent as a corpse, embarrassed and distraught. Remus had a ferocious glare in his eyes.

“Hate to break it to you sweetheart, but this is who I am and if you don’t like it, you can go on and piss off” He stormed off as Y/N felt rooted to the ground. Something was terribly wrong and Y/N had to find out and help Remus in anyway possible.



Y/N had pursued the Marauders through the night and heard off preparations for the night with mentions of ‘leaving’. There was the answer. All Y/N had to do was follow the Marauders. Though, Y/N could not shake off a sense of uneasiness. After help from Marlene, Y/N hid in the Gryffindor common room waiting for the Marauders expected exit. After everyone had retreated towards their respective dormitories, the Marauders came down shortly afterward in dark cloaks. Dread seemed to follow in their wake. Y/N waited until the Marauders trudged a few yards ahead, she trekked along, her dark cloak billowing behind her.

“Come one, we’re late” Potter urged.

The rest of them seemed to be filled with a sense or urgency and treaded faster. They disappeared behind a door and Y/N followed suit. As they continued to advance, Y/N could have sworn Remus growling heavily under his breath. Soon, the light of a full moon bathed their skin and Y/N was created by the sound of a tranquil night. Usually welcomed, such a peaceful night seemed inappropriate for such a grim night.  Y/N observed as Remus’ gait faltered and his movements became nearly animalistic.

“Come on, Remus! Nearly there, mate!” Black encouraged, desperation laced in his voice.

Remus dropped to the ground his chest heaving. He seemed to tear at his chest and grabbed desperately to his neck. His distress was evident. Y/N wanted to approach him, embrace him, and tell him that everything was all right. Something held her back. As Remus continued to grow frantic, something impossible occurred. The other three transformed. Suddenly, their ridiculous nicknames made sense. Wormtail, Padfoot, and Prongs. Moony. It all had clicked. He would leave every three to four weeks on a full moon. He would grow aggressive, nearly animalistic. Remus was a werewolf. Y/N was in danger. Y/N watched as Remus transformed and howled towards the moon, as if damning it for causing him such misery.

Y/N felt a burning resentment towards the moon for causing him such anguish. He paused and began to sniff the air. Padfoot seemed to catch on. Immediately, their gazes turned towards you and Remus charged towards you.

Y/N tried to flee, but a sudden jerk sent Y/N spiraling towards a tree. Y/N hit the tree with a sharp thud and landed with a crack. She let out a bloodcurdling scream. A sharp pain pulsed through her arm. Remus approached as Y/N tried to escape, but then felt a stinging on  her thigh. As she looked down, the leg was soaked in blood. She stared up to find Remus staring her straight in the eyes. She silently pleaded with him and he had seemed to listen. Suddenly, He was ripped from her vision as Padfoot plowed in to him. They were distracting him.Finding it hard to stand and even think, Prongs aided Y/N and let her lean on him as he guided her quickly towards the door.

She slipped through the trap door and examined her thigh. It was a deep laceration that was pulsing out dark red blood. Y/N grabbed her wand.

“Episkey” she muttered wand pointed towards her wound. She had to make it to the common room. The wound refused to heal. The spell had been of little help. She had limited time and she knew it. Y/N stumbled down trying her hardest not to lose consciousness. Grabbing on to her thigh and the walls when walking was becoming much to hard, she made her way towards the door.

“Help!” Y/N mustered to cry out. “Please!” She cried as she say McGonagall rushing towards her.

“Oh, dear! Stay with me!” McGonagall cried as Y/N lost consciousness.



The smell of flowers and antiseptic filled Y/N senses.  She was in the hospital wing. Y/N turned to her side and saw Remus shaggy, sandy blonde hair. Her heart fluttered until she realized why they were both there. He looked miserable once more and it pained to see him like this. Y/N reached out to grab Remus’ hand and he jumped at the sudden warmth.

“Hello.” Y/N spoke meekly

“I am so sorry.”

“It’s all right.”

“No! I’m a monster. I should terrify you! You should despise me!”

“Nonsense!”

Nonsense? Look at you.” His voice strained and his eyes filled with heartache.”It’s all my fault!”

Y/N felt horrible. She never should have followed them. “Don’t be ridiculous. It was all mine. I should have known better.” Y/N squeezed his hand tighter.

“How can you not hate me?” Y/N’s heart shattered.

“Because it’s not your fault.”


“I’m a monster. Look, at what I did to you! You could have died. How can you not blame me! I did this. I could have killed you! Don’t you hate me!” He cried out tears running down his cheeks. Y/N grew desperate to stop his anguish.

“Remus, you are not a monster! You are a kind, intelligent young man who I know would never hurt a fly on purpose.”

“But I hurt you!”

“And I forgive you”

“Why!”

“Because I love you!”

Y/N stumbled down trying her hardest not to lose consciousness. Grabbing on to her thigh and the walls when walking was becoming much to hard, she made her way towards the door.

“Help!” Y/N mustered to cry out. “Please!” She cried as she say McGonagall rushing towards her.

“Oh, dear! Stay with me!” McGonagall cried as Y/N lost consciousness.



The smell of flowers and antiseptic filled Y/N senses.  She was in the hospital wing. Y/N turned to her side and saw Remus shaggy, sandy blonde hair. Her heart fluttered until she realized why they were both there. He looked miserable once more and it pained to see him like this. Y/N reached out to grab Remus’ hand and he jumped at the sudden warmth.

“Hello.” Y/N spoke meekly

“I am so sorry.”

“It’s all right.”

“No! I’m a monster. I should terrify you! You should despise me!”

“Nonsense!”

Nonsense? Look at you.” His voice strained and his eyes filled with heartache.”It’s all my fault!”

Y/N felt horrible. She never should have followed them. “Don’t be ridiculous. It was all mine. I should have known better.” Y/N squeezed his hand tighter.

“How can you not hate me?” Y/N’s heart shattered.

“Because it’s not your fault.”


“I’m a monster. Look, at what I did to you! You could have died. How can you not blame me! I did this. I could have killed you! Don’t you hate me!” He cried out tears running down his cheeks. Y/N grew desperate to stop his anguish.

“Remus, you are not a monster! You are a kind, intelligent young man who I know would never hurt a fly on purpose.”

“But I hurt you!”

“And I forgive you”

“Why!”

“Because I love you!”
trail.content:
Summary: Reader becomes suspicious of Remus’ odd behaviors and becomes determined to get to the bottom of it.

A//N: a bit of angst and mentions of blood and near death experiences

            Finding out about his lycanthropy was surprising to say the least. Although, Y/N felt idiotic for not realizing it sooner.

 It was a gradual process of deduction which began when Remus would refuse studying and the such every three to four weeks that coincided which a full moon, or that Potter, Black, and Pettigrew were on his heel at every waking moment and fulfilling his every desire and repelling any unwanted company. Remus would develop erie sense of isolation  and he’d become easily irritated or upset. This was a bit of a shock considering Remus’ usual calm and shy demeanor. Though, Y/N was never too suspicious. In fact, Y/N had rarely considered it to be too concerning. It was Remus after all. The most reliable person on the planet Y/N would know.

Of course, Y/N felt a pang of empathy for Remus, but after knowing each other for such a long time this cycle became far too familiar. Although, she could not deny how it pained to watch a close friend be so miserable.

It wasn’t until Amelia had brought it up that Y/N really found it odd.

“Do you ever find it curious that Remus always leaves around the same time each month?” She had asked after transfiguration.

“Pardon?” Y/N asked, looking away from Remus grimly trailing behind Potter, Black, and Pettigrew as they joked around.

“You’ve never noticed that he misses class due to a family illness, a distant relative coming over, or an excuse like that? I mean you off all people should notice Remus’ absence. It’s not like you never sh-”

“All right! I get it.” Y/N exclaimed blushing at Amelia’s antics.

“But really, you don’t find it curious”

“Well, yes, but…?” Y/N had never really put much thought in to it. “It is a bit curious” Y/N concluded eyeing Remus whose shoulders seemed to sink into the ground. It was all too monotonous.



Y/N approached Remus on their way to the great hall, deciding to put an end to the mysterious cycle.

“Hey, Rem!” She called out after Remus, giddily running up to him, and greeted him with a warm grin as an attempted to lift his spirits.

“Hello.” He returned the greeting with an indifferent inflection in his voice. Y/N felt a pang of hurt of his lack of excitement, but her mission did not waver and proceeded.

“So, everything ok?” Y/N asked expectingly

“Yes, why wouldn’t it be?” He seemed very defensive, but Y/N continued.

“Well, you seem a bit off. I don’t know, I just see you acting very-“ Y/N didn’t know how to word it. Miserable. Standoffish. Fearful. “I just want to know if my friend is all right.”

“I’m fine.” He stated, obviously irritated.

“Well, you know you can tell me anything. I’ll help anyway I can. I just—You get so angry-” Y/N regretted those words immediately.

“And what! You don’t like me like this! Is this an inconvenience  for you! Does this disturb you!” Remus roared out, stopping everyone in their tracts. She stood as silent as a corpse, embarrassed and distraught. Remus had a ferocious glare in his eyes.

“Hate to break it to you sweetheart, but this is who I am and if you don’t like it, you can go on and piss off” He stormed off as Y/N felt rooted to the ground. Something was terribly wrong and Y/N had to find out and help Remus in anyway possible.



Y/N had pursued the Marauders through the night and heard off preparations for the night with mentions of ‘leaving’. There was the answer. All Y/N had to do was follow the Marauders. Though, Y/N could not shake off a sense of uneasiness. After help from Marlene, Y/N hid in the Gryffindor common room waiting for the Marauders expected exit. After everyone had retreated towards their respective dormitories, the Marauders came down shortly afterward in dark cloaks. Dread seemed to follow in their wake. Y/N waited until the Marauders trudged a few yards ahead, she trekked along, her dark cloak billowing behind her.

“Come one, we’re late” Potter urged.

The rest of them seemed to be filled with a sense or urgency and treaded faster. They disappeared behind a door and Y/N followed suit. As they continued to advance, Y/N could have sworn Remus growling heavily under his breath. Soon, the light of a full moon bathed their skin and Y/N was created by the sound of a tranquil night. Usually welcomed, such a peaceful night seemed inappropriate for such a grim night.  Y/N observed as Remus’ gait faltered and his movements became nearly animalistic.

“Come on, Remus! Nearly there, mate!” Black encouraged, desperation laced in his voice.

Remus dropped to the ground his chest heaving. He seemed to tear at his chest and grabbed desperately to his neck. His distress was evident. Y/N wanted to approach him, embrace him, and tell him that everything was all right. Something held her back. As Remus continued to grow frantic, something impossible occurred. The other three transformed. Suddenly, their ridiculous nicknames made sense. Wormtail, Padfoot, and Prongs. Moony. It all had clicked. He would leave every three to four weeks on a full moon. He would grow aggressive, nearly animalistic. Remus was a werewolf. Y/N was in danger. Y/N watched as Remus transformed and howled towards the moon, as if damning it for causing him such misery.

Y/N felt a burning resentment towards the moon for causing him such anguish. He paused and began to sniff the air. Padfoot seemed to catch on. Immediately, their gazes turned towards you and Remus charged towards you.

Y/N tried to flee, but a sudden jerk sent Y/N spiraling towards a tree. Y/N hit the tree with a sharp thud and landed with a crack. She let out a bloodcurdling scream. A sharp pain pulsed through her arm. Remus approached as Y/N tried to escape, but then felt a stinging on  her thigh. As she looked down, the leg was soaked in blood. She stared up to find Remus staring her straight in the eyes. She silently pleaded with him and he had seemed to listen. Suddenly, He was ripped from her vision as Padfoot plowed in to him. They were distracting him.Finding it hard to stand and even think, Prongs aided Y/N and let her lean on him as he guided her quickly towards the door.

She slipped through the trap door and examined her thigh. It was a deep laceration that was pulsing out dark red blood. Y/N grabbed her wand.

“Episkey” she muttered wand pointed towards her wound. She had to make it to the common room. The wound refused to heal. The spell had been of little help. She had limited time and she knew it. “Hello.” Y/N spoke meekly

“No! I’m a monster. I should terrify you! You should despise me!”

“Nonsense!”

Nonsense? Look at you.” His voice strained and his eyes filled with heartache.”It’s all my fault!”

Y/N felt horrible. She never should have followed them. “Don’t be ridiculous. It was all mine. I should have known better.” Y/N squeezed his hand tighter.

“I’m a monster. Look, at what I did to you! You could have died. How can you not blame me! I did this. I could have killed you! Don’t you hate me!” He cried out tears running down his cheeks. Y/N grew desperate to stop his anguish.

chat

:

Me, a Bulgarian: it’s Victor KRUMOV. KRUM is the…

more proof JKR did negative research on everything

the most infuriating thing is she got some team members names’ right? Clara Ivanova is correct, albeit Clara is not a bulgarian name and not many people would use it BUT OK, I’LL TAKE IT. Like literally the same motif goes for the rest. But Victor KRUM has grated on my nerves for 15 years now. and hell even the other one she mentions? 

Lev Zograf? - FIRST OF ALL. Lev is  RUSSIAN NAME. It means “Lion”. Way back in the 19th century people used “Lev” to mean lion (hell our national hero’s pseudonim is Levski (i.e. of the lion). Now the word is slightly different. The sound does not exist in any other language that I know of but the closest english transcription would be “l-a-v”. LEV today is the name of our currency. 

Zograf is the family name of one of our 19th century artist (Zahariy Zograf). Zograf literally means “artist” in old Bulgarian. Today this name would be “Zografski” and again you don’t come upon it very often. 

So really, Lev Zograf, sounds sounds like a name I would encounter when reading about 10th century Bulgarian history. Like that’s very OUT OF REALITY.

Like I just checked the stuff for the entire team AND SHE LITERALLY TOOK RUSSIAN NAMES AND PUT THEM ON THE BULGARIAN NATIONAL TEAM AND THEN PULLED MORE OF THAT “FIRST NAME AS A FAMILY NAME” BULLSHIT. LIKE NO BITCH NO. WE AIN’T RUSSIAN. WE AIN’T RUSSIA. WE ARE FUCKING OLDER THAN RUSSIA. FUCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCK

summary: Me, a Bulgarian: it's Victor KRUMOV. KRUM is the first name of one of the most well known and feared Bulgarian Khans from the...
body: Me, a Bulgarian: it's Victor KRUMOV. KRUM is the first name of one of the most well known and feared Bulgarian Khans from the 8-9th centuries. KRUMOV as a surname means "Of Krum". BULGARIAN SURNAMES HAVE A SET SUFFIX ( -ov, -ev, -ski) AND A SET GENDER (-ov, -ev, -ski [m] and -ovA, -evA, -skA [f]). THIS GOES FOR ALL BULGARIAN SURNAMES THERE ARE NO GODDAMN EXCEPTIONS. THIS IS NOT YOUR BRITISH SURNAMES WHERE IT COULD BE WHATTHEFUCKEVER. Krum as a surname SURNAME is BRITISH/ WESTERN GARBAGE.

title: addicted pt. ii

pairing: sirius black x reader

wordcount: 1600

genre: angst & eventual fluff

status: INCOMPLETE

warnings: underage drinking and slight/short nsfw scene

summary: the arrangement that you and sirius had is over so why are you not getting over him?

A/N: i lied when i said i would post the fluffy sirius fic oops. also changed canon a little bit so it’s one person per room at hogwarts. i think it fits the story better. also this is really rushed and i’m so sorry i’m terrible with pacing but i wanted this posted and–

read: addicted pt. i

read: addicted masterlist

l masterlist l taglist l faq l request l

In the coming days, you stopped hanging around not only Sirius, but the Marauders altogether. In fact, the boys hadn’t seen you in days and they were beginning to worry.

“I’m telling you, Moony, she was probably kidnapped,” James says one day at the Great Hall as he takes a bite of his sandwich. Sirius snorts.

“I saw her walking down the halls just the other day,” Peter replies, and it’s James’ turn to snort. 

“Impossible. If she were still at school, she’d be hanging out with us right now.” James declares nonchalantly.

“That doesn’t mean anything. She could be busy.” Remus assures but he doesn’t sound like he believes it himself. After all, you were ignoring any messages they sent to you and stopped coming to any of your shared classes with the boys. It just wasn’t like you to stop talking to them with a trace.

“Busy? She just disappeared off of the face of the Earth, Moony! Aren’t you at least a little worried?" 

"Of cour-”

“You have got some nerve, Black!” All of the boys turn to see Marlene and Lily hurriedly rushing to their table. Sirius distinctly hears a ’lovely to see you, Evans’ followed by a ’not now, Potter’ but his attention is turned towards the fuming blonde in front of him.

“How dare you,” she frowns as she points an accusatory finger at him. He can already feel a headache coming on and the boys beside him are trying to hide their grins. 

“Oooh, what’d he do this time, Mar? Because I don’t think anything can top the 24 howlers filled with profanities that I sent you on your birthday last year,” James says proudly but Marlene continues to glare at Sirius.

“You broke her heart,” she says, ignoring James. Sirius’ eyebrows furrow and he has the gall to ask ‘who?’ because you’re the only person he’d been with for months but he doesn’t believe that you’d ever be heartbroken over him.

“Are you serious?” Lily asks incredulously and the boys James giggles beside him. He knows that they’re just waiting for him to say it. His eyes flicker between the girls and the rest of the Marauders.

“Err… yes?” He answers, half because he is serious and half because he is Sirius. James bursts out laughing and Peter joins in timidly. Remus is just shaking his head in disappointment. 

“He said it! Look at their faces!” James cackles while Lily and Marlene both look at each other in disbelief. Did Sirius really think this was a joking matter? Marlene looks like she’s going to bite his head off but Lily shakes her head. If he thought this was funny then there was no reason to yell at him. He wouldn’t understand. But she’s clearly still upset as she gives Sirius one last glance.

“I really hope Y/N never forgives you. Let’s go, Marlene.” The redhead scoffs as she grabs Marlene’s arm and pulls her away. But when Sirius hears your name his ears perk up and he wants to ask more but the boys are already making a fuss at the table.

“Did she say Y/N?”

“Is that why she hasn’t been hanging out with us recently?”

“What did you do, Sirius?”

Their questions are drowned out by the pounding Sirius can feel in his head. He gave you time to move on, so why weren’t you moving on? Were you really heartbroken over him? Or were Marlene and Lily lying? They had to be, right? His mind is racing and he’s tempted to ask you all about it and see for himself but he doesn’t know if he’d be able to handle seeing you again.

As luck would have it, Sirius doesn’t see you until the next night.

—

“Pl-please,” you croak. “I gave you ti-me to breathe-e but I want you to m-make me yours agai-n.”

Frankly, he’s surprised. Who would’ve thought that you’d be by his dorm room at 4 AM in the morning asking him to sleep with you? He takes in the sight of your disheveled hair and reddened cheeks and raises a brow. 

“Y/N, are you drunk?”

“Pleas-e,” you repeat when he doesn’t move to let you inside. 

He bites his lip. It’s a selfish request, definitely, but he wants to grant it so badly. The way you’re shivering and looking up at him so desperately makes him sure of that fact.

’You can’t!’ His mind reasons. ’She’s drunk!' 

“O-only a li-ttle drunk,” you pout as you scan his face. You know exactly what he’s thinking and he flushes. Of course you can. You’d always been highly intuitive when it came to him. When he still doesn’t answer, you decide to make the choice for him and press your lips against his gently. Your hands affectionately toy with his soft sweater as you lean into him.

“Please?” You mumble again, peering up at him through your eyelashes. Maybe it’s the way you don’t stutter when you ask or maybe it’s how irresistibly cute you look in that moment, but his resolve crumbles and it’s only seconds later when he’s carrying you into his room. He moves to sit on the edge of his bed and situates you onto his lap with both of your legs around him. You’re gently squirming against him for some more friction as you whine.

“Baby, baby, baby,” he groans as he steadies you onto his lap so you can grind against him. Your head dips forward onto his shoulder and he can hear you desperately panting into his ear.

“Si-Sirius,” you whisper and he replies with a breathless ’yeah?’. You simply continue to rock your hips against him even faster, making him splutter. If you continue then he might just come right then and there, but then you stop trailing kisses down his neck and reach up to grasp onto his arms as tightly as you can. When your body starts trembling and you hide your face into his shoulder, he gets a little worried.

“What’s wrong baby?” He’s somewhat proud that his voice comes out steady despite how wrecked he feels.

“Sirius, I love you s-so so mu-ch,” you warble. He can hear the sincerity in your tone and pulls you back so he can see your face. You don’t let him though— your fingers are gripping at his black sweater so firmly that they’ve turned slightly white. By now, your movements have slowed and there’s a pause in the air. Sirius feels his heart skip a beat and he doesn’t want to ruin the mood by telling you to leave because he doesn’t think he can bear having you ignore him again after such a heartfelt confession. Actually, he wants to tell you that he loves you too, Merlin, he loves you so much it hurts sometimes. And he’s just about to tell you all that but you manage to speak before him and what really doesn’t help is that your next sentence sends a jolt straight at his heart and has his ears exploding with sound.

“I lo-ve you so w-why did you have to le-ave? D-did I do somethi-ng wrong?

Is it be-cause I’m no-t good e-enough…?”

He can feel the tears seeping onto his shoulder before he sees them. Your breaths are coming out ragged as you burrow deeper into his shoulder. He doesn’t think that he can feel any worse but then he hears you trying to muffle your whimpers and his arms are instantly wrapped 10x tighter around you. 

“No! Shit, Y/N, no, I’m sorry,” he blurts but that’s all he can say. He can say sorry a million times but it won’t do anything. You’re not drunk enough to believe him. But drunk enough to pass out in his arms? Maybe. He feels you slump in his arms but continues apologizing. 

“I’m sorry, Y/N, I didn’t think you’d still be hung up over me, I mean, it’s been weeks and you can have anyone you want. You’re… perfect. I still love you so much. I love you. I do. I never stopped loving you so please don’t think you’re not good enough. I’m the one who isn’t good enough for you and fuck, I never thought you’d be hurting this much or believe that it was your fault because it’s not your fault, it’s mine, I’m an idiot for leaving you,” he whispers against your hair hopelessly as he holds you against him.

He wants you to believe him and waits for any sign of acknowledgment. When you don’t reply, he reluctantly pulls himself away from you and sees your eyes are closed and your lips are parted slightly. To be honest, a part of him is a little relieved that you didn’t hear his sappy confession but the other part is upset because that means that you didn’t hear him telling you that he’s the one who isn’t good enough for you.

He feels the faint stirring of something warm in his chest as he gazes at you, though. It reminds him of when you’d sleep over at his dorm and you’d spend the whole night laughing and telling stories. He decides that this would be the last moment he’d ever have you this close to him ever again and carefully tucks you into his bed. He gently gets in beside you and wraps his arms around you. He feels you nuzzling closer towards him and breathes out a content sigh. Placing a gentle kiss on your forehead, he’s sure of one thing.

He wants to stay like this forever.

As luck would have it, Sirius doesn’t see you until the next night.

—

“Pl-please,” you croak. “I gave you ti-me to breathe-e but I want you to m-make me yours agai-n.”

Frankly, he’s surprised. Who would’ve thought that you’d be by his dorm room at 4 AM in the morning asking him to sleep with you? He takes in the sight of your disheveled hair and reddened cheeks and raises a brow. 

“Y/N, are you drunk?”

“Pleas-e,” you repeat when he doesn’t move to let you inside. 

He bites his lip. It’s a selfish request, definitely, but he wants to grant it so badly. The way you’re shivering and looking up at him so desperately makes him sure of that fact.

’You can’t!’ His mind reasons. ’She’s drunk!' 

“O-only a li-ttle drunk,” you pout as you scan his face. You know exactly what he’s thinking and he flushes. Of course you can. You’d always been highly intuitive when it came to him. When he still doesn’t answer, you decide to make the choice for him and press your lips against his gently. Your hands affectionately toy with his soft sweater as you lean into him.

“Please?” You mumble again, peering up at him through your eyelashes. Maybe it’s the way you don’t stutter when you ask or maybe it’s how irresistibly cute you look in that moment, but his resolve crumbles and it’s only seconds later when he’s carrying you into his room. He moves to sit on the edge of his bed and situates you onto his lap with both of your legs around him. You’re gently squirming against him for some more friction as you whine.

“Baby, baby, baby,” he groans as he steadies you onto his lap so you can grind against him. Your head dips forward onto his shoulder and he can hear you desperately panting into his ear.

“Si-Sirius,” you whisper and he replies with a breathless ’yeah?’. You simply continue to rock your hips against him even faster, making him splutter. If you continue then he might just come right then and there, but then you stop trailing kisses down his neck and reach up to grasp onto his arms as tightly as you can. When your body starts trembling and you hide your face into his shoulder, he gets a little worried.

“What’s wrong baby?” He’s somewhat proud that his voice comes out steady despite how wrecked he feels.

“Sirius, I love you s-so so mu-ch,” you warble. He can hear the sincerity in your tone and pulls you back so he can see your face. You don’t let him though— your fingers are gripping at his black sweater so firmly that they’ve turned slightly white. By now, your movements have slowed and there’s a pause in the air. Sirius feels his heart skip a beat and he doesn’t want to ruin the mood by telling you to leave because he doesn’t think he can bear having you ignore him again after such a heartfelt confession. Actually, he wants to tell you that he loves you too, Merlin, he loves you so much it hurts sometimes. And he’s just about to tell you all that but you manage to speak before him and what really doesn’t help is that your next sentence sends a jolt straight at his heart and has his ears exploding with sound.

“I lo-ve you so w-why did you have to le-ave? D-did I do somethi-ng wrong?

Is it be-cause I’m no-t good e-enough…?”

He can feel the tears seeping onto his shoulder before he sees them. Your breaths are coming out ragged as you burrow deeper into his shoulder. He doesn’t think that he can feel any worse but then he hears you trying to muffle your whimpers and his arms are instantly wrapped 10x tighter around you. 

“No! Shit, Y/N, no, I’m sorry,” he blurts but that’s all he can say. He can say sorry a million times but it won’t do anything. You’re not drunk enough to believe him. But drunk enough to pass out in his arms? Maybe. He feels you slump in his arms but continues apologizing. 

“I’m sorry, Y/N, I didn’t think you’d still be hung up over me, I mean, it’s been weeks and you can have anyone you want. You’re… perfect. I still love you so much. I love you. I do. I never stopped loving you so please don’t think you’re not good enough. I’m the one who isn’t good enough for you and fuck, I never thought you’d be hurting this much or believe that it was your fault because it’s not your fault, it’s mine, I’m an idiot for leaving you,” he whispers against your hair hopelessly as he holds you against him.

He wants you to believe him and waits for any sign of acknowledgment. When you don’t reply, he reluctantly pulls himself away from you and sees your eyes are closed and your lips are parted slightly. To be honest, a part of him is a little relieved that you didn’t hear his sappy confession but the other part is upset because that means that you didn’t hear him telling you that he’s the one who isn’t good enough for you.

He feels the faint stirring of something warm in his chest as he gazes at you, though. It reminds him of when you’d sleep over at his dorm and you’d spend the whole night laughing and telling stories. He decides that this would be the last moment he’d ever have you this close to him ever again and carefully tucks you into his bed. He gently gets in beside you and wraps his arms around you. He feels you nuzzling closer towards him and breathes out a content sigh. Placing a gentle kiss on your forehead, he’s sure of one thing.

He wants to stay like this forever.

In the coming days, you stopped hanging around not only Sirius, but the Marauders altogether. In fact, the boys hadn’t seen you in days and they were beginning to worry.

“I’m telling you, Moony, she was probably kidnapped,” James says one day at the Great Hall as he takes a bite of his sandwich. Sirius snorts.

“I saw her walking down the halls just the other day,” Peter replies, and it’s James’ turn to snort. 

“Impossible. If she were still at school, she’d be hanging out with us right now.” James declares nonchalantly.

“That doesn’t mean anything. She could be busy.” Remus assures but he doesn’t sound like he believes it himself. After all, you were ignoring any messages they sent to you and stopped coming to any of your shared classes with the boys. It just wasn’t like you to stop talking to them with a trace.

“Busy? She just disappeared off of the face of the Earth, Moony! Aren’t you at least a little worried?" 

"Of cour-”

“You have got some nerve, Black!” All of the boys turn to see Marlene and Lily hurriedly rushing to their table. Sirius distinctly hears a ’lovely to see you, Evans’ followed by a ’not now, Potter’ but his attention is turned towards the fuming blonde in front of him.

“How dare you,” she frowns as she points an accusatory finger at him. He can already feel a headache coming on and the boys beside him are trying to hide their grins. 

“Oooh, what’d he do this time, Mar? Because I don’t think anything can top the 24 howlers filled with profanities that I sent you on your birthday last year,” James says proudly but Marlene continues to glare at Sirius.

“You broke her heart,” she says, ignoring James. Sirius’ eyebrows furrow and he has the gall to ask ‘who?’ because you’re the only person he’d been with for months but he doesn’t believe that you’d ever be heartbroken over him.

“Are you serious?” Lily asks incredulously and the boys James giggles beside him. He knows that they’re just waiting for him to say it. His eyes flicker between the girls and the rest of the Marauders.

“Err… yes?” He answers, half because he is serious and half because he is Sirius. James bursts out laughing and Peter joins in timidly. Remus is just shaking his head in disappointment. 

“He said it! Look at their faces!” James cackles while Lily and Marlene both look at each other in disbelief. Did Sirius really think this was a joking matter? Marlene looks like she’s going to bite his head off but Lily shakes her head. If he thought this was funny then there was no reason to yell at him. He wouldn’t understand. But she’s clearly still upset as she gives Sirius one last glance.

“I really hope Y/N never forgives you. Let’s go, Marlene.” The redhead scoffs as she grabs Marlene’s arm and pulls her away. But when Sirius hears your name his ears perk up and he wants to ask more but the boys are already making a fuss at the table.

“Did she say Y/N?”
